name: Cracked Chronos
description: As research into the anomaly crisis intensifies in the wake of the Q's disappearance, several crews are sent back to the 20th and 21st century, the result of an accident. But is it? Uncover the truth while honoring the Temporal Prime Directive.
rules:
-- Unique Supply Missions are available during the event. Open the Event to access them.
-- Using 2024 Picard, any version of Janeway, Kira, Kirk, or Displaced crew will provide a bonus to Supply Missions.
-- Every Supply Mission you complete earns you Event Victory Points. Collect Event Victory Points to unlock Threshold Rewards!
-- Community Rewards are only available during Phase 1. Collect Event Victory Points to unlock these rewards before the phase change!
-- In this event, Squadrons may also compete to advance up the Squadron leaderboards. Join a Squadron to get more rewards!
bonus_text: Crew Bonus: Janeway, Kira, Kirk, 2024 Picard, or Displaced
rewards_teaser: Reach Rank 1 by gaining Victory Points from Event Supply Missions!

featured_crew.name: Archer
featured_crew.flavor: Archer and T’Pol end up in 2004 Detroit and must stop the Xindi Reptilians.

action.name: Try to Stay Out of Trouble

featured_crew.name: Kira
featured_crew.flavor: While trying to find Sisko, Kira, along with O’Brien, ends up in the late 1960s, where they encounter a pair of hippies.

rewards.name: Chronitons
rewards.flavor: Chronitons allow your crew to take action in these chaotic times. Use Chronitons to replay parts of past missions via the Timeline.

rewards.name: Georgiou
rewards.flavor: Aboard the Discovery, Georgiou adopts the disguise of an Admiral when under inspection by the Earth Defense Force.

action.name: I Had To Make It Believable

rewards.name: Training
rewards.flavor: Increases crew XP by 2500.

rewards.name: Chronitons
rewards.flavor: Chronitons allow your crew to take action in these chaotic times. Use Chronitons to replay parts of past missions via the Timeline.

rewards.name: Credits
rewards.flavor: Credits are the galaxy's standard currency. Use Credits in the Time Portal to enlist crew members, build items, and more.

rewards.name: Honor
rewards.flavor: Honor is gained by dismissing crew who have served you well, but are ready for reassignment. Redeem in the Time Portal for exclusive crew, special fusion-related items, training programs, and more.

rewards.name: Voyage Revival
rewards.flavor: Use to instantly revive a failed Voyage.

action.name: Try to Stay Out of Trouble

rewards.name: Rarity
rewards.flavor: Contains ONE of the following 5 Polestars: Common, Uncommon, Rare, Super rare, Legendary

rewards.name: Skill
rewards.flavor: Contains ONE of the following 6 Polestars: Command, Diplomacy, Security, Engineering, Science, Medicine

rewards.name: ISM
rewards.flavor: ISM, or interstellar medium, is the matter that exists between astronomical objects. It can be manipulated by the Q to facilitate crew retrieval. ISM can be obtained from Daily Log-in Rewards, Campaigns and participating in Fleet activities.

rewards.name: Dilithium
rewards.flavor: Dilithium is your most valuable asset. Use Dilithium in the Time Portal to acquire valuable crew members, items, and more.

rewards.name: Honor
rewards.flavor: Honor is gained by dismissing crew who have served you well, but are ready for reassignment. Redeem in the Time Portal for exclusive crew, special fusion-related items, training programs, and more.

rewards.name: ISM
rewards.flavor: ISM, or interstellar medium, is the matter that exists between astronomical objects. It can be manipulated by the Q to facilitate crew retrieval. ISM can be obtained from Daily Log-in Rewards, Campaigns and participating in Fleet activities.

rewards.name: Dilithium
rewards.flavor: Dilithium is your most valuable asset. Use Dilithium in the Time Portal to acquire valuable crew members, items, and more.

rewards.name: Honor
rewards.flavor: Honor is gained by dismissing crew who have served you well, but are ready for reassignment. Redeem in the Time Portal for exclusive crew, special fusion-related items, training programs, and more.

rewards.name: Merits
rewards.flavor: Merits can be earned by completing missions. Use Merits to acquire faction-based rewards, upgrades to your ship, and more.

rewards.name: Training
rewards.flavor: Increases crew XP by 2500.

rewards.name: Archer
rewards.flavor: Archer and T’Pol end up in 2004 Detroit and must stop the Xindi Reptilians.

adventures.name: The Way It Is
adventures.description: Ensure everyone is aware of the Temporal Prime Directive.

adventures.name: Titanium
adventures.description: Support starship computers with existing technology.

adventures.name: Who I Am
adventures.description: Gather a manifest of all displaced individuals.

adventures.name: Debriefing
adventures.description: Compile all of the details of the current situation.

rewards.name: Kira
rewards.flavor: While trying to find Sisko, Kira, along with O’Brien, ends up in the late 1960s, where they encounter a pair of hippies.

rewards.name: 10x Portal
rewards.flavor: 10 valuable items. Go to Time Portal to collect!

goals.flavor: Find answers and keep the peace with the Bajorans.
Assimilate yourself into the present with the Borg.

screens.text: "What a relief, finally a real answer to my hails. Despite our attempts to adjust our frequencies, we keep ending up with vulgar 20th century talk radio and intercepted wireless phone calls."

"What are your ship's sensor readings telling you, Captain? If they're anything like ours, you've probably realized by now we're not in the 24th century anymore. According to the positioning of the stars on our end, we've reached Earth - circa 1997."

"We were actually departing the Sol system when we encountered some sort of anomaly. But the fact that your ship has gone back in time tells me there might be others. We should seek out anyone else who has come back in time and ensure that no possible temporal violations occur."
"What a relief, finally a real answer to my hails. Despite our attempts to adjust our frequencies, we keep ending up with vulgar 20th century talk radio and intercepted wireless phone calls."

"What are your ship's sensor readings telling you, Captain? If they're anything like ours, you've probably realized by now we're not in the 24th century anymore. According to the positioning of the stars on our end, we've reached Earth - circa 1997."

"We were actually departing the Sol system when we encountered some sort of anomaly. But the fact that your ship has gone back in time tells me there might be others. We should seek out anyone else who has come back in time and ensure that no possible temporal violations occur."
"Thank you for connecting me with everyone, Captain. Not that I don't love the whole 'peace and love' ideal of these 'hippies' on 1960s Earth, but it's all a little...much for my tastes."
"Did you say the 1960s? So we haven't all arrived in the same time period, even though it seems we've all been sent back to either the 20th or 21st century..."

responses.text: "Any leads on what exactly caused this?"

screens.text: "From the individuals I've been able to make contact with, it appears we've landed in different years. Yet somehow, those operating on the Federation standard frequency are able to maintain contact despite years or even decades apart."

"I suspect it has something to do with why we were on Earth in the first place. A cadre of Federation scientists were studying our crew and several others who had arrived via temporal anomaly to see if any new information could be gained. Perhaps something in their research..."
"A fair question. I suspect the nature of the anomalies that brought us back through history has something to do with it, though we'll need more data to figure out what exactly."

"Well, I thought being on Earth in the 24th century was an adjustment but...Captain, your ancestors are strange. And do you have any idea what 'groovy' means? Or why they keep telling me I'm 'far out, man'?"
"Well, the sooner we get answers, the sooner we can go home. It's not that I don't love sharing an apartment with Jim and Spock but...well, no, I don't love it. Let's hurry up and find a way home."
"Thank you for connecting me with everyone, Captain. Not that I don't love the whole 'peace and love' ideal of these 'hippies' on 1960s Earth, but it's all a little...much for my tastes."
"Did you say the 1960s? So we haven't all arrived in the same time period, even though it seems we've all been sent back to either the 20th or 21st century..."

responses.text: "Any leads on what exactly caused this?"

screens.text: "From the individuals I've been able to make contact with, it appears we've landed in different years. Yet somehow, those operating on the Federation standard frequency are able to maintain contact despite years or even decades apart."

"I suspect it has something to do with why we were on Earth in the first place. A cadre of Federation scientists were studying our crew and several others who had arrived via temporal anomaly to see if any new information could be gained. Perhaps something in their research..."
"A fair question. I suspect the nature of the anomalies that brought us back through history has something to do with it, though we'll need more data to figure out what exactly."

"Well, I thought being on Earth in the 24th century was an adjustment but...Captain, your ancestors are strange. And do you have any idea what 'groovy' means? Or why they keep telling me I'm 'far out, man'?"
"Well, the sooner we get answers, the sooner we can go home. It's not that I don't love sharing an apartment with Jim and Spock but...well, no, I don't love it. Let's hurry up and find a way home."
